titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph's Brethren, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:26

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of poetry and letters produced by members of Joseph's Brethren. Also included is an etched print of members' signatures by Emerson Tuttle (the first master of Davenport College).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 40 (YRG 40), Records of Yale clubs, societies and organizations.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joseph's Brethren, Yale University, Records (RU 868). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joseph's Brethren was an informal group composed of members of Yale's English literature faculty. Its membership included Charles Seymour (Y 1908 and former president of Yale), Chauncey B. Tinker (Y 1899), Henry S. Canby (SSS 1899), Lee W. Dodd (SSS 1899), Alfred R. Bellinger (Y 1917), and John C. Adams (Y 1896).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of poetry and letters produced by members of Joseph's Brethren. Also included is an etched print of members' signatures by Emerson Tuttle (the first master of Davenport College).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by type of material.
